trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Directory extensions | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Directory extensions | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the directory extensions feature in Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the directory extensions feature in Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Directory extensions
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Directory extensions

trans-unit.source: Directory extensions allows you to extend the schema in Azure AD with your own attributes from on-premises Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Directory extensions allows you to extend the schema in Azure AD with your own attributes from on-premises Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to build LOB apps consuming attributes you continue to manage on-premises.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to build LOB apps consuming attributes you continue to manage on-premises.

trans-unit.source: These attributes can be consumed through [Azure AD Graph directory extensions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/Library/Azure/Ad/Graph/howto/azure-ad-graph-api-directory-schema-extensions) or [Microsoft Graph](https://graph.microsoft.io/).
trans-unit.target: These attributes can be consumed through [Azure AD Graph directory extensions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/Library/Azure/Ad/Graph/howto/azure-ad-graph-api-directory-schema-extensions) or [Microsoft Graph](https://graph.microsoft.io/).

trans-unit.source: You can see the attributes available using [Azure AD Graph explorer](https://graphexplorer.cloudapp.net) and [Microsoft Graph explorer](https://graphexplorer2.azurewebsites.net/) respectively.
trans-unit.target: You can see the attributes available using [Azure AD Graph explorer](https://graphexplorer.cloudapp.net) and [Microsoft Graph explorer](https://graphexplorer2.azurewebsites.net/) respectively.

trans-unit.source: At present no Office 365 workload will consume these attributes.
trans-unit.target: At present no Office 365 workload will consume these attributes.

trans-unit.source: You configure which additional attributes you want to synchronize in the custom settings path in the installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: You configure which additional attributes you want to synchronize in the custom settings path in the installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: Schema Extension Wizard
trans-unit.target: Schema Extension Wizard

trans-unit.source: The installation will show the following attributes, which are valid candidates:
trans-unit.target: The installation will show the following attributes, which are valid candidates:

trans-unit.source: User and Group object types
trans-unit.target: User and Group object types

trans-unit.source: Single-valued attributes
trans-unit.target: Single-valued attributes

trans-unit.source: Strings, Integer, Binary
trans-unit.target: Strings, Integer, Binary

trans-unit.source: An object can have up to 100 directory extensions attributes.
trans-unit.target: An object can have up to 100 directory extensions attributes.

trans-unit.source: The max length is 250 characters.
trans-unit.target: The max length is 250 characters.

trans-unit.source: If an attribute value is longer, it will be truncated by the sync engine.
trans-unit.target: If an attribute value is longer, it will be truncated by the sync engine.

trans-unit.source: During installation of Azure AD Connect, an application will be registered where these attributes will be available.
trans-unit.target: During installation of Azure AD Connect, an application will be registered where these attributes will be available.

trans-unit.source: You can see this application in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can see this application in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Schema Extension App
trans-unit.target: Schema Extension App

trans-unit.source: These attributes will now be available through Graph:
trans-unit.target: These attributes will now be available through Graph:

trans-unit.source: Graph
trans-unit.target: Graph

trans-unit.source: The attributes are prefixed with extension\_{AppClientId}\_.
trans-unit.target: The attributes are prefixed with extension\_{AppClientId}\_.

trans-unit.source: The AppClientId will have the same value for all attributes in your Azure AD directory.
trans-unit.target: The AppClientId will have the same value for all attributes in your Azure AD directory.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
